page.title: 19Staploe, Children and School
page.content: 36 school age children in the 3 hamlets attend 9 different schools. By bus to Colmworth Lower School (10), Great Barford Middle (7), Sandy Upper (5), Special School Biggleswade (1) and by car to Bedford Catholic School (2), Bushmead Primary (2), Special School Cambridge, weekly boarder (1), Great Staughton Primary (1), Kimbolton (2). There are 17 children under school age. Most are concentrated in Duloe and Staploe leaving Honeydon with 6 school children and 4 infants.Loneliness is solved by visiting others or travelling to play school. For Sunday School, children must go into Eaton Socon. Pre-war, Staploe Gospel Hall, now closed, had a roll of 41 and in 50/60s about 20. Honeydon Methodist Chapel had 15 children. Its Sunday School closed in 1970. Many village events are held.
